⊢ (∀(s0 ∈ Even,(4[<]s0 → s0 ∈ GoldbachEven))↔ ∀(s0 ∈ Even,(2[<]s0 → ∃(s1 ∈ Prime, ∃(s2 ∈ Prime, s0 =(s1[+]s2))))))
⊣ d(s1, s2)
⊣ d(s0, s1)
⊣ d(s0, s2)

comment: An alternate (related to the original) formulation of the binary Goldbach conjecture: Every even integer greater than 2 can be expressed as the sum of two primes. (Contributed by AV, 22-Jul-2020.)
